definition: to listen/to hear/to obey/a can (loanword from English "tin")/classifier for canned beverages
(literary pronunciation, still advocated in Taiwan) to rule/to sentence/to allow

sentences.english: With corsets , you can just tug on the ties.
sentences.chinese: 与助听器，你可以在刚刚舨联系。

sentences.english: The front of the ear hook in the hearing aid, is to connect the ear mould channel.
sentences.chinese: 耳钩位于助听器的最前端，是连接耳模的通道。

sentences.english: Ask client to remove hearing aid and close eyes.
sentences.chinese: 嘱受检者取下助听器，闭眼。

sentences.english: The maintenance centre inspects audiphones free of charge for the AGED people of 70 and over.
sentences.chinese: 本维修中心为70岁以上老人免费检验助听器。

sentences.english: Gee- I sure wish that old guy who lives next door would buy himself a hearing aid.
sentences.chinese: 嗨，我真希望隔壁那老头儿能给本身买个助听器。

sentences.english: An old man suffered hard of hearing because of old age, so his son bought him a hearing aid.
sentences.chinese: 一老汉年高耳背，儿子便给他买了一个助听器。

sentences.english: The real ear insertion gain measrement is one of methods in hearing aids fitting.
sentences.chinese: 真耳介入增益法是助听器常用的验配方法之一。

sentences.english: To wear hearing aids when driving.
I got my hearing aid on the National (Service).
sentences.chinese: 我赌助听器是国民保健署厥蹬。

sentences.english: Operation of hearing aids and heart pacemakers is permitted.
sentences.chinese: 但是，允许使用助听器和心脏起博器。

sentences.english: How natural is the sound from your hearing aids?
sentences.chinese: 你的助听器所接收的声音顺耳自然吗？

sentences.english: Objective To discuss methods of hearing aids fitting for hearing-impaired people with loudness recruitment.
sentences.chinese: 目的探讨伴有重振的听力障碍者助听器验配方法。

sentences.english: They decided to “yoke” the old man with the hearing aid.
sentences.chinese: 他们决定抢劫那个带助听器的老头。

sentences.english: Current production of hearing aids meets less than 10% of global need.
sentences.chinese: 目前生产的助听器只能满足不到10%的全球需求。

sentences.english: The AARP doesn’t need a hearing aid manufacturer to function.
sentences.chinese: AARP的运营不需要一个助听器的生产商。

definition: to put on/to wear (mouthguard, contact lenses, hearing aid etc)
